Read a file based on this extension

read_ext.Rd

Read a file based on this extension

Default method for reading files

For CSV files

For parquet files

For RDS files

For SAS files

For XPT files

Usage

read_ext(path, ...)

# Default S3 method
read_ext(path, ...)

# S3 method for class 'csv'
read_ext(path, ...)

# S3 method for class 'parquet'
read_ext(path, ...)

# S3 method for class 'rds'
read_ext(path, ...)

# S3 method for class 'sas7bdat'
read_ext(path, ...)

# S3 method for class 'xpt'
read_ext(path, ...)

Arguments

path

Path to the file

...

Other parameters for read's functions

Value

the result of the reading function

Examples

temp_csv <- tempfile("iris", fileext = ".csv")
write.csv(iris, temp_csv, row.names = FALSE)
class(temp_csv) <- "csv"
read_ext(temp_csv)
#> Rows: 150 Columns: 5
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (1): Species
#> dbl (4): Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> # A tibble: 150 × 5
#>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
#>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  
#>  1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  2          4.9         3            1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 setosa 
#>  4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2 setosa 
#>  5          5           3.6          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4 setosa 
#>  7          4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3 setosa 
#>  8          5           3.4          1.5         0.2 setosa 
#>  9          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#> 10          4.9         3.1          1.5         0.1 setosa 
#> # ℹ 140 more rows
temp_txt <- tempfile("iris", fileext = ".txt")
write.csv(iris, temp_txt, row.names = FALSE)
class(temp_txt) <- "txt"
read_ext(temp_txt)
#> ℹ Using vroom to read the file:
#> Rows: 150 Columns: 5
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (1): Species
#> dbl (4): Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> # A tibble: 150 × 5
#>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
#>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  
#>  1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  2          4.9         3            1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 setosa 
#>  4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2 setosa 
#>  5          5           3.6          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4 setosa 
#>  7          4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3 setosa 
#>  8          5           3.4          1.5         0.2 setosa 
#>  9          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#> 10          4.9         3.1          1.5         0.1 setosa 
#> # ℹ 140 more rows
